Laura Prepon

[Watchung](/wiki/Watchung,_New_Jersey "Watchung, New Jersey"), [New

**Laura Prepon** (born March 7, 1980) is an American actress, director, and
author. She is best known for her role as [Donna
Pinciotti](/wiki/Donna_Pinciotti "Donna Pinciotti") in all eight seasons of
the [Fox](/wiki/Fox_Broadcasting_Company "Fox Broadcasting Company") sitcom
_[That'70s Show](/wiki/That_%2770s_Show "That '70s Show")_ (1998–2006), and
for her portrayal of [Alex Vause](/wiki/Alex_Vause "Alex Vause") in the
[Netflix](/wiki/Netflix "Netflix") original comedy-drama series _[Orange Is
the New Black](/wiki/Orange_Is_the_New_Black "Orange Is the New Black")_
(2013–present). Prepon has worked mainly in television. She made her film
debut in 2001 with the independent film _[Southlander](/wiki/Southlander
"Southlander")_. Her other films include the romantic drama _[Come Early
Morning](/wiki/Come_Early_Morning "Come Early Morning")_ (2006), the comedy
_[Lay the Favorite](/wiki/Lay_the_Favorite "Lay the Favorite")_ (2012), the
thriller _[The Girl on the Train](/wiki/The_Girl_on_the_Train_\(2016_film\)
"The Girl on the Train \(2016 film\)")_ (2016), and the drama _[The
Hero](/wiki/The_Hero_\(2017_film\) "The Hero \(2017 film\)")_ (2017).

## Early
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Laura_Prepon&action=edit&section=1&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Early life")]

Prepon was born on March 7, 1980, in [Watchung, New
Jersey](/wiki/Watchung,_New_Jersey "Watchung, New Jersey"),[1] the youngest of
five children, to Marjorie (née Coll), a high school teacher, and Michael
Prepon, an [orthopedic surgeon](/wiki/Orthopedic_surgery "Orthopedic
surgery").[1] She is of [Russian Jewish](/wiki/Russian_Jews "Russian Jews")
and [Irish Catholic](/wiki/Irish_Catholic "Irish Catholic") descent.[2] Her
maternal great-great-great-grandfather was Union Army General [Joseph Bradford
Carr](/wiki/Joseph_Bradford_Carr "Joseph Bradford Carr").[3] Prepon's father
died during heart surgery in 1993 at age 49;[4] she was 13 years old at the
time. She attended [Watchung Hills Regional High
School](/wiki/Watchung_Hills_Regional_High_School "Watchung Hills Regional
High School"), and later studied at the Total Theatre Lab in [New York
City](/wiki/New_York_City "New York City").[1]

##
Career[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Laura_Prepon&action=edit&section=2&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Career")]

###
1995–2005[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Laura_Prepon&action=edit&section=3&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: 1995–2005")]

Prepon appeared in plays such as _A Woman of Property_ and _Ascension Day_
while in New York.[1] In 1996, she studied drama with acting teacher Caroline
Thomas at Thomas' Total Theatre Lab.[5] Later, in September 1997, she
premiered on a [Levi Strauss](/wiki/Levi_Strauss_%26_Co. "Levi Strauss &
Co.")-developed show called _[They Go On](/wiki/They_Go_On "They Go On")_ , an
[Internet](/wiki/Internet "Internet")-based [soap opera](/wiki/Soap_opera
"Soap opera").[6] Prepon had also worked as a model and has done photo shoots
in Paris, Milan, and Brazil.[1]

Prepon starred as [Donna Pinciotti](/wiki/Donna_Pinciotti "Donna Pinciotti")
on the [Fox](/wiki/Fox_Broadcasting_Company "Fox Broadcasting Company") sitcom
_[That'70s Show](/wiki/That_%2770s_Show "That '70s Show")_ from 1998 to 2006.
Donna became the girlfriend and next-door neighbor of [Eric
Forman](/wiki/Eric_Forman "Eric Forman") ([Topher Grace](/wiki/Topher_Grace
"Topher Grace")). Randy Pearson ([Josh Meyers](/wiki/Josh_Meyers_\(actor\)
"Josh Meyers \(actor\)")), who was introduced in the eighth and final season
of the series, became Donna's third love interest after Grace left the series.

Prepon co-starred in the romantic comedy _[Slackers](/wiki/Slackers_\(film\)
"Slackers \(film\)")_ , which is about three best friends who try to scam
their way through college and eventually get caught.[7] She was nominated for
a Teen Choice Award in 2002 for her role in _That '70s Show_.[8] In 2001, she
made her film debut in [Steve Hanft](/wiki/Steve_Hanft "Steve Hanft")'s
musical comedy-drama _[Southlander](/wiki/Southlander "Southlander")_ with
[Beck](/wiki/Beck "Beck"), [Beth Orton](/wiki/Beth_Orton "Beth Orton") and
[Hank Williams III](/wiki/Hank_Williams_III "Hank Williams III"), where she
played Seven=Five, a young TV telepathic. In 2004, Prepon worked on the
independent drama film _The Pornographer: A Love Story_. The film tells the
story of an obsessive relationship between a director and an actress.

Prepon was named one of _[Stuff](/wiki/Stuff_\(magazine\) "Stuff
\(magazine\)")_ magazine's "102 Sexiest Women In The World" in 2002 and one of
_[Maxim](/wiki/Maxim_\(magazine\) "Maxim \(magazine\)")_ magazine's "Hot 100"
in 2005.[9] Prepon had a cameo voice appearance as a United Nations Space
Command marine in _[Halo 2](/wiki/Halo_2 "Halo 2")_ , which was released in
2004.[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation
needed")_] Her first notable film role came in 2004 with the dark drama
_[Lightning Bug](/wiki/Lightning_Bug_\(film\) "Lightning Bug \(film\)")_ with
[Bret Harrison](/wiki/Bret_Harrison "Bret Harrison"), [Kevin
Gage](/wiki/Kevin_Gage_\(actor\) "Kevin Gage \(actor\)") and [Ashley
Laurence](/wiki/Ashley_Laurence "Ashley Laurence"). Branching into other
arenas than acting, Prepon also served as executive producer of the
film.[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation
needed")_] She also appeared on an episode of _[MTV's
Cribs](/wiki/MTV%27s_Cribs "MTV's Cribs")_ in 2003.[10]

###
2005–2010[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Laura_Prepon&action=edit&section=4&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: 2005–2010")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Laura_Prepon.jpg/220px-
Laura_Prepon.jpg)](/wiki/File:Laura_Prepon.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Laura_Prepon.jpg "Enlarge")

Prepon in 2008

In 2005, Prepon co-starred with [Misha Collins](/wiki/Misha_Collins "Misha
Collins") in the psychological thriller _[Karla](/wiki/Karla_\(film\) "Karla
\(film\)")_ , based on the true story of [Paul Bernardo](/wiki/Paul_Bernardo
"Paul Bernardo") and his wife [Karla Homolka](/wiki/Karla_Homolka "Karla
Homolka"), a Canadian couple who kidnapped, sexually abused, and murdered
three girls, marking a contrast to her usual lighthearted roles.[11] She was
also an [executive producer](/wiki/Executive_producer "Executive producer") of
_[E! Hollywood Hold'em](/wiki/E!_Hollywood_Hold%27em "E! Hollywood Hold'em")_
the same year.[12] Prepon co-starred with [Bryan
Greenberg](/wiki/Bryan_Greenberg "Bryan Greenberg") as Hannah Daniels in the
[ABC](/wiki/American_Broadcasting_Company "American Broadcasting Company")
drama _[October Road](/wiki/October_Road_\(TV_series\) "October Road \(TV
series\)")_ , which debuted March 15, 2007. The show was canceled by ABC on
May 12, 2008, despite strong ratings and a grassroots campaign from the show's
fanbase to keep the show alive. In April 2007, she starred in a dramatic short
film _Once Upon a Time_. She also appeared in the 2005
[Oxygen](/wiki/Oxygen_\(TV_channel\) "Oxygen \(TV channel\)") original
romantic comedy _[Romancing the Bride](/wiki/Romancing_the_Bride "Romancing
the Bride")_. She also was the original voice for [Hayley
Smith](/wiki/Hayley_Smith_\(American_Dad!\) "Hayley Smith \(American Dad!\)")
on the Fox animated sitcom _[American Dad!](/wiki/American_Dad! "American
Dad!")_ and voiced her in an unaired pilot.[_[citation
needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")_] She
appeared as Lauren, the long-lost sister of [Mary Shannon](/wiki/Mary_Shannon
"Mary Shannon") ([Mary McCormack](/wiki/Mary_McCormack "Mary McCormack")) in
the [USA Network](/wiki/USA_Network "USA Network") mystery drama _[In Plain
Sight](/wiki/In_Plain_Sight "In Plain Sight")_ in the episode "A Frond in
Need".[13] On February 5, 2010, it was announced that Prepon signed on to star
in _Awkward Situations for Men_ , a pilot on ABC.[14] In 2009, Prepon appeared
in the CBS sitcom _[How I Met Your Mother](/wiki/How_I_Met_Your_Mother "How I
Met Your Mother")_ as Karen, one of the girlfriends of [Ted
Mosby](/wiki/Ted_Mosby "Ted Mosby") ([Josh Radnor](/wiki/Josh_Radnor "Josh
Radnor")), in the episode "[Sorry, Bro](/wiki/Sorry,_Bro "Sorry, Bro")". She
reprised her role in the episodes "[The Front Porch](/wiki/The_Front_Porch
"The Front Porch")" in 2009 and "[Say
Cheese](/wiki/Say_Cheese_\(How_I_Met_Your_Mother\) "Say Cheese \(How I Met
Your Mother\)")" in 2010. She also appeared in the Fox medical drama _[House
M.D.](/wiki/House_\(TV_series\) "House \(TV series\)")_ in the episode
"Private Lives".[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed
"Wikipedia:Citation needed")_]

Prepon had been taking directing classes at the [Art Center College of
Design](/wiki/Art_Center_College_of_Design "Art Center College of Design").
She directed a short film, _Abide with Me_ , about a 10-year-old boy who,
"upon bearing witness to his father's murder, is rendered mute." Prepon stated
she plans on making _Abide with Me_ into a feature film.[15]

###
2011–present[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Laura_Prepon&action=edit&section=5&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: 2011–present")]

In early 2011, Prepon guest-starred in an episode of the ABC police procedural
drama _[Castle](/wiki/Castle_\(TV_series\) "Castle \(TV series\)")_ as an
actress studying for the role of [Nikki Heat](/wiki/Nikki_Heat "Nikki Heat"),
a character created by [Nathan Fillion](/wiki/Nathan_Fillion "Nathan
Fillion")'s title character.[16] Prepon had been working on a web series,
_Neighbros_ , which she directed and edited, starring her then-boyfriend
[Scott Michael Foster](/wiki/Scott_Michael_Foster "Scott Michael Foster").
They had sold the series to [Comedy Central](/wiki/Comedy_Central "Comedy
Central").[17][18] In February 2011, she was cast as the title character
Chelsea Newman on the [NBC](/wiki/NBC "NBC") sitcom _[Are You There,
Chelsea?](/wiki/Are_You_There,_Chelsea%3F "Are You There, Chelsea?")_ , based
on [Chelsea Handler](/wiki/Chelsea_Handler "Chelsea Handler")'s 2008 book
_[Are You There, Vodka? It's Me,
Chelsea](/wiki/Are_You_There,_Vodka%3F_It%27s_Me,_Chelsea "Are You There,
Vodka? It's Me, Chelsea")_.[19] NBC cancelled the show on May 11, 2012. She
guest-starred in the [TBS](/wiki/TBS_\(U.S._TV_channel\) "TBS \(U.S. TV
channel\)") sitcom _[Men at Work](/wiki/Men_at_Work_\(TV_series\) "Men at Work
\(TV series\)")_.[20] In mid-2012, Prepon signed on to play [Alex
Vause](/wiki/Alex_Vause "Alex Vause"), a former drug importer and girlfriend
of [Piper Chapman](/wiki/Piper_Chapman "Piper Chapman"), in the
[Netflix](/wiki/Netflix "Netflix") original comedy-drama series _[Orange Is
the New Black](/wiki/Orange_Is_the_New_Black "Orange Is the New Black")_ ,
based on [Piper Kerman](/wiki/Piper_Kerman "Piper Kerman")'s memoir _[Orange
Is the New Black: My Year in a Women's
Prison](/wiki/Orange_Is_the_New_Black:_My_Year_in_a_Women%27s_Prison "Orange
Is the New Black: My Year in a Women's Prison")_. The series premiered in July
2013.[21] Prepon was a regular in the first season, but appeared in only four
of the 13 episodes in the second season. She returned as a series regular in
the third season.[22]

In 2016, Prepon and nutritionist Elizabeth Troy co-wrote _The Stash Plan_ , a
wellness book that draws on Prepon's experiences eating organic foods since
she was a child, and her struggles with weight, low energy, and digestive
issues.[23][24][25] The book debuted at #10 under "Advice, How-To &
Miscellaneous" on [_The New York Times_ Best Seller
list](/wiki/The_New_York_Times_Best_Seller_list "The New York Times Best
Seller list").[26]

In 2016, Prepon appeared in the psychological thriller _[The Girl on the
Train](/wiki/The_Girl_on_the_Train_\(2016_film\) "The Girl on the Train \(2016
film\)")_ , based on [Paula Hawkins](/wiki/Paula_Hawkins_\(author\) "Paula
Hawkins \(author\)")' [novel of the same
name](/wiki/The_Girl_on_the_Train_\(novel\) "The Girl on the Train
\(novel\)").[27] In 2017, she played Charlotte opposite [Sam
Elliott](/wiki/Sam_Elliott "Sam Elliott") in _[The
Hero](/wiki/The_Hero_\(2017_film\) "The Hero \(2017 film\)")_.[28] Prepon
directed the tenth episode of _Orange Is the New Black_ 's fifth season,
titled "The Reverse Midas Touch".[29]

## Personal
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Laura_Prepon&action=edit&section=6&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Personal life")]

Prepon dated [Scott Michael Foster](/wiki/Scott_Michael_Foster "Scott Michael
Foster") for a time, but said in 2013 they had broken up.[30][18] In June
2017, a pregnant Prepon confirmed on _[Live with Kelly and
Ryan](/wiki/Live_with_Kelly_and_Ryan "Live with Kelly and Ryan")_ that she and
her fiancé, actor [Ben Foster](/wiki/Ben_Foster "Ben Foster"), were expecting
a girl.[31] The parents did not announce a birth date, but Prepon in September
2017 talked of being a working mother,[32][33] and in April 2018 made public
their daughter's name, Ella.[34] Prepon and Foster live in New York.[35]

Prepon is a practicing [Scientologist](/wiki/Scientology "Scientology").[36]
